etymology.interpretation: Combines 广, originally a cliff/eaves element meaning a building or shelter, with 敞 as the phonetic chǎng ‘spacious, open’. The industrial sense ‘factory’ arises from a large, open work building, with 敞 supplying the pronunciation.
etymology.simplification: 廠 was simplified to 厂 by dropping the phonetic 敞 and retaining only the abbreviated semantic shelter/cliff element; this follows a common reform pattern of removing phonetics for high-frequency characters and coincides with an existing simple graph 厂, while keeping the reading chǎng.

examples.chinese: 我在化工厂上班(我在化工廠上班)。
examples.english: I work at a chemical factory.

examples.chinese: 这家厂去年搬迁了(這家廠去年搬遷了)。
examples.pinyin: Zhè jiā chǎng qùnián bānqiān le.

examples.chinese: 工人们在厂里加班(工人們在廠裡加班)。
examples.english: The workers are working overtime in the factory.
